feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 21 at 3:36PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ..Elevated Surf Through Sunday... Elevated surf will continue through Sunday and cause minor beach erosion. West winds gusting to 55 mph will decrease to 25 mph by noon Sunday. Residents with items on the beach should move them inland to prevent them from washing away. The strongest winds, highest surf and greatest erosion will be
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 21 at 3:36PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Through Tonight... Elevated surf will continue through tonight and cause minor beach erosion. Northwest winds gusting to 25 mph will decrease to 15 mph late tonight. The elevated surf will continue through this evening, then decrease after midnight.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 10 PM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 inches. Visibility one half mile or less at times. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Baldwin Peninsula.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 21 at 9:06AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Through This Afternoon... Elevated surf will continue through this afternoon and cause minor beach erosion. Northwest winds gusting to 30 mph will decrease to 15 mph this afternoon. The elevated surf will continue through this afternoon, then decrease this evening. People at Utqiagvik should be aware of increased beach erosion

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 10:32PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Storm With Heavy Snow and Blowing Snow Possible Sunday Night Through Monday Night... A strong storm moving into the Western Bering and Chukchi Seas on Sunday will move along the West Coast of Alaska on Monday. This will bring a mix of rain and snow and south winds 30 mph gusting to 50 mph to the West Coast of Alaska west of Golovin and
entry.cap:areaDesc: Interior Seward Peninsula; Noatak Valley

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 10:32PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Storm With High Surf Possible Sunday Night Through Monday Night... South winds of 30 mph with gusts to 50 mph over the Bering and Chukchi Seas on Sunday will spread to the West Coast of Alaska Sunday night into Monday. This will bring the possibility of high surf and minor coastal flooding to the West Coast of Alaska from

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued October 21 at 1:32PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT DUE TO ELEVATED PARTICULATE MATTER LEVELS FROM WINDBLOWN DUST... The South Coast AQMD has issued an air quality alert due to increased particulate matter from blowing dust. The air quality alert is in effect from 5 PM on Saturday until Noon on Monday. In areas directly impacted by high levels of windblown dust, limit

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 21 at 9:25AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The Saint Johns River near Astor is forecast to continue slowly falling through Minor Flood Stage into next week. For the St. Johns River...including Astor...Minor flooding is forecast.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.summary: ...HIGH FIRE DANGER CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHWEST AND WESTCENTRAL GEORGIA DUE TO LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND STRONG WINDS ..
